reviews.text: First time in years eating here and it was a great experience. Service - no water refills but very courteous and prompt. Food - I loved the shrimp dish especially the read tomato sauce that accompanied it. The Greek salad with adding grilled chicken was average in the best way possible, but the cauliflower pita was excellent per my boyfriend. It was very fresh. He said he would order it again. Vibe - dinner throwback vibe with a modern twist. Overall, I would recommend this place for a healthy or hearty meal.

Came in with three families 8 adults and 4 kids and we arrived at the same time as a bus full of highschool kids on a field trip. Service was great! That alone was worth 5 stars.
Food came out hot and as ordered. We had everything from a traditional breakfast platter to vegan taco platter. No complaints and it was all delicious. Drinks stayed full and even gave us to go drinks.
Prices are solid and portions are great

A good spot for traditional American breakfast. You will find the classic dinner entrees plus more gourmet options. First come first serve, notice that during the weekends you could be waiting in line a few minutes. Outside sitting is also available.
What a great place! Old school diner with fresh local foods. We went for breakfast and we were completely satisfied with the food and service. Definitely going to check this out again for lunch.

We dined in at Sliver Diner recently for dinner and here’s how it went:

Pros:
Service was quick and friendly. I throughly enjoyed the overall vibe of the place as I generally like diners. We had a friendly waiter and he was nice. I got a milkshake for desert and that was a tasty one. I definitely liked it.

Cons:
The only flaw I see is over the food. I ordered the fish and chips and in which the fries were good but the fish had a weird texture to it which didn’t seem right for my liking.

But overall, 4 out of 5 stars for Sliver Diner!

Food was tasteful with good presentation. Servers were helpful and polite. However, our Large Group (no reservation) resulted in a long wait after the order of our food. Just over 95 minutes for a party of over 20 people. Would recommend advising the servers to provide the food as they are completed in lieu of serving at the same time. Noted other customers in restaurant were able to order, receive food, and complete meal before our party even got our food.

Great place for authentic Mexican food. Arrived there around 7PM with a group of 6. In less than 10 minutes we were already seated. Very friendly staff and the food was great. The portions were decent and the prices reasonable. Overall, a great experience. Highly recommended!

This restaurant had a bit of a wait which turned out great because we had to sit at the bar and met Zach. He made us feel so welcome and really made a boring night out actually fun. Great personality, quick and professional service. I’m ready to come back and hang with my buddy Zach at the bar. It was my first time here and he definitely left a lasting impression.

The food here is just  alright. This isn't the best Uncle Julio's by a long shot.

Bad acoustics, so when it gets crowded, it's really loud. The decor is all mismatched. Different flooring, different wallpapers, random paintings and mirrors all over.

For the food... The chips were half acceptable, half stale. Enchiladas were on the bland side, the chicken honestly didn't look fully cooked. Chicken bowl has mushy rice, barely any chicken, and only a tiny spoonful of guacamole. Our margarita was salted on only one side....? Strange.

The food and service are still fast, and the location is convenient. But there's something really wrong here, it's better to try some local food instead.
The food and service was greatly appreciate! No complaints. The food was excellent and different but tasty ! Happy hour starts 3pm & ends 6pm.

A lovely brunch atmosphere that is light on the wallet and heavy on the pours. Choose from a small list of bottomless liquor options which pair nicely with the avocado toast or the all American breakfast, my personal favorite was the chicken sausage and my salmon eggs Benedict it was *chef kiss*! Parking wasn’t the best so getting their prior to your reservation time is key Sundays are awesome cuz parking is free otherwise 2 hour parking signs are your best bet. Come hungry and leave happy the customer service and food was a lovely  Sunday Brunch outing! Liberty Tavern did not disappoint, stop by if you’re in the area!

Loved this place! Their outside seating is 🐾DOG FRIENDLY🐾. The service was excellent and very attentive. And the food! Absolutely delicious. The best fried chicken sandwich and tomato soup! Highly recommend.

My sister and I decided to go to Liberty to celebrate our reunion! Brunch was delicious! I definitely enjoyed my first big brunch back after being away for a few months. My favorites were the biscuits, shrimp and grits, and veggie quiche. The French toast and deviled eggs were just ok. I also tasted the fried chicken with the hot honey. Goodness! I didn’t drink alcohol but my sister tasted some of their drinks. I believe they have a grapefruit drink that she liked. I had orange juice that was in a large glass. Great service. Will return!

Very attentive service!
Every dish was in pretty huge portion but some lacks refinement in presentation.
Do get the all-American breakfast!

Some of the best food we’ve had so far, the Scottish Salmon was cooked perfectly and the greens and mushrooms were nicely buttered. Didn’t expect it to be proper food, but it was. The Rigatoni  and meatball was also prepared really well. The half portion is perfect for one person.

The inside was a bit loud, but that’s to be expected on a Friday night. The waiter was really friendly and overall we had an excellent experience. They did have seating outside, which we will do next time. Definitely coming back again.

Ordered delivery from this location.  Was delivered on time by Door Dash.  Great tasting Handmade Shrimp Dumplings (6) and Sweet and Sour Chicken.  Well protected by plastic containers and even a wonderful looking bag.  Great food but when you add delivery charge, estimared fees (?), and tip it amounts to almost half my grocery bill.
The food was wonderful, a five out of five, but even without all those add ons it would cost over 28 dollars.  And, to be honest, that is still a little high.  Glade I tried them out, maybe in the future will dine-in, but no more delivery.

Wow very beautiful establishments. One of the best places I've been to in My Life. The food was superb. I have to tip my hat to the chef. Even though they were short staff they did a awesome job thank you..

Do not recommend. Ordered pick up online. Got order home to find that the Kung Pao Chicken was missing the peanuts and celery. Menu cost of this meal was $19.90. It wasn't worth half of that cost. I gave one extra star because the hostess was nice.

Ordered The Sea Bass & when when I bit into the texture was weird. I cut it down the middle sm it’s absolutely raw. I called the establishment and was told report it to Door Dash.
No apology or investigation of why they are serving raw food. This was completely unacceptable!! I look done on the outside but clearly the seared it of one min max.

Save your money and time! It’s not worth it!
I called to place an order for orange chicken got all the way home and the chicken tasted old the sauce was watery. Highly disappointed I will not be returning!!! I called to speak with the manager waited an hour for them to just get back on the phone and ask me for my number and said the manger will give me a call back because he had to leave because he had an emergency. So you mean to tell me it's nobody else working who can get on the phone and speak with customers since the manager is unavailable.

Good food. Friendly staff. Went on a Sunday around 10 and it wasn’t really that packed. Food didn’t take too long and tasted good. Wanted more coffee refills but the waiter only came by one time for the refill and really didn’t come by to ask if we needed anything else. They didn’t seem understaffed so I don’t know what the reason was.

I visited an IHOP after several years so was not surprised to see a lot of changes. However, I was happy that they still maintain the same level of cleanliness and courtesy.

We were immediately greeted when we entered and seated in a booth. We had gone at a slightly odd time (around 3pm) which is in between lunch and dinner, so the wait staff was limited to only one person. After seating us he went around a few times taking care of other customers and we were beginning to get somewhat impatient when he came over and apologized and took our order.

Being a lacto-vegan, my requirements tend to confuse restaurant staff and this was no exception. He kept trying to steer me towards items that had eggs in them while I kept explaining that eggs were not an option. Finally he got somewhat exasperated and recommended that I go with my original idea of only French fries. However a quick search on the internet revealed that their cheese sandwiches did not have any animal products other than milk so we settled on it.

Once he took the order the service was prompt. The food was good. We spend quite a bit of time chatting and even though he realized that we were not going to order any more he came by a few times offering to refill our water glasses.

I was a bit surprised by the prices, but I guess with the way things have been impacted by the inflation and the fact that we were in an expensive part of the city may have contributed to it.

All in all a good experience

Wish I could give this location 10 stars. This is our second year visiting DC. We drove to this location several times over the past 2 visits.

Restaurant and restrooms were spotless. It is always decorated for the holiday. The staff are amazing. They all hustle, are friendly and you can tell they work well together and support each other. Food is fast and really delicious compared to other locations.

We fell in love with our sever Saba and we were so excited she was still there a year later. Im attaching pics from our visit from 2021 & 2022.

Highly recommend this location to anyone.

The server was very patient with us because two of our party of seven got waylaid trying to find parking after we were seated. Since it was veterans day, two of us got our meals for free. Everyone enjoyed our food, and as always, you can't beat IHOP pancakes!

Yummmmmmmy to our Tummy!! The food was beyond well made. And our waitress was a class act!! We will drive pass every IHOP just to see Marcela!! You are the true star of this IHOP!!  Promote this lady to Manager ASAP!! She is attentive, caring and has a heart of gold. She checked on all her guest and ensured our meal was cooked to perfection!! This has been our best outing since the beginning of COVID!! The restaurant is clean and truly comfortable. Well done. #TeamMarcela alllllll day!!! You rock!!

We ate here on a Monday night so it was pretty quiet but we had such a lovely experience!! All of the fondue was great, I think especially the cheese (we had spinach & artichoke) and chocolate. The meat tasted fresh and we really liked all of the sauce options (variety and quality). Everything was fantastic, it's always a treat to come here. Also I can't remember our server's name but he was wonderful to us and really made our experience fantastic!! Thank you!!

I went there for my sister birthday and it was our first time. It was such a great experience.

We choose four course dinner for 2 and TBH it was a lot for us and be prepared to spend not less one hour there if you chose it. Everything was really tasty and delicious. The service was good.

I would love to give this restaurant a million stars! My husband and I booked a reservation for 8:30, our waiter was named Adam, he was very attentive. His energy and way of explaining the dishes to us made it an extraordinary night. This was our first time at the Melting pot, it was perfect. Each course was delicious, we enjoyed every bit of it. The seats were also secluded and the restaurant was not noisy, so you really get that romantic feel. The place was very clean and elegant and all of the staff were kind. We ended up being the last guests in the restaurant, thank you for letting us take our time to dine. We haven’t dined in anywhere since Covid, and this experience was as perfect as we could have hoped for. Thank you thank you!

We haven’t been to a Melting Pot in ages and it was a fun thing to revisit. I wish we had remembered how big the portions were because we DEF had ordered toooo much food, lol! Our cute waiter Brandon (sp. ?) was a gem and ever most attentive without becoming over bearing. The venue was so cute, clean, and huge! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves 😊

We had a spectacular experience at The Melting Pot last night, for drinks, we ordered NA Pineapple Cobbler and NA strawberry Basil Lemonade; then we ordered Fiesta Cheese Fondue. For salad we ordered MP House Salad and California, California was so good! For entrée we ordered The Classic BRC and Steak Lovers BRC; for deserts, we ordered The original SM and Yin & Yang SM, we enjoyed Yin & Yang far better, but all the food was really good, so was the service.
They offer their customers and guests a discount on parking, we payed $2 only!

This was recommended to me to visit so I made the trek and was pleasantly surprised.  It's tucked away but the GPS led me right in.   The chicken was seasoned perfectly and I also had beans and flan for dessert.  I'm glad to have ventured out and tried it.

Pollo Rico is one of the best Peruvian chicken places around. They’re yellow and green sauces go perfectly with their chicken, which is seasoned just right. The restaurant is always packed and the service is great.

Unreal. This restaurant lives up to its name—the chicken is muy muy rico. The chicken is well seasoned and unbelievably tender. It’s a cheaper, tastier version of Nando’s. Fries are wonderful, coleslaw is tasty too. Could benefit from a wider sauce selection, but otherwise, no complaints.

Staff is wonderfully kind and warm. Highly recommend.

I am born and raised in Arlington and me and my family have been going here since, I was born! Pollo Rico is by far the very best Peruvian chicken in all the area and I don't care what anyone says. If you don't believe me, go there yourself and you will always see long lines no matter what the day is. Their chicken is always juicy and always have excellent flavoring that you can always remember. Fries (steak fries) and coleslaw are excellent! If you're in Arlington go and check it out!

Still my favorite Peruvian chicken restaurant in DC.  The chicken is moist and has a nice peppery flavor.  Like others, I wish they had other side options like yucca, but I will keep coming regardless.

Good food, quick service, friend staff, but smaller servings. Also the food we picked up was packed sideways which caused it to leak all over everything else. An unpleasant surprise when we got home. The beets in the beet salad had no taste whatsoever which was odd. I love beets so that was a disappointment. Slightly overpriced for what you're getting. Perhaps it's better in person than take out.

I was at this restaurant for a meetup. It was nice and quiet inside although the outdoor eating areas looked busier. I had the spinach artichoke dip. It was delicious! The portion size was kind of small but the quality and tastiness made up for that. The other members of my party all seemed to enjoy their food as well. The staff were polite. Parking was horrible. Only street parking right around the restaurant. The closest parking garage is a couple of blocks away. We parked in this garage. It is a huge parking garage and we had trouble finding our car when we returned. It's a garage where you definitely should take a note of the level and section you parked in.

This place is all looks nothing to show for it. Upon first impressions it’s got lots of reviews (I didn’t see if they were great reviews), located in a great area in Arlington, beautiful ambiance outside and inside.

We called ahead for reservations same day for a table of 9 on a Monday. When we arrived 30mins early our table was already set up and ready. The place was pretty empty on a Monday night. They had a lot of staff working though. The waiter was young and very nice. Our waiter handled a table of 9 people very well. I wish I remembered his name. Our waters were constantly refilled. However, ordering and getting our food out was a bit slow.

Drinks weren’t great. I personally was a little difficult about my drink order. I ordered a margarita with casamigo tequila because on the menu it said margarita, pick tequila. However what I failed to realize and the waiter failed to mention is that the list of tequila available was all the way to the right. Their top shelf was patron. So I asked for a Mojito and they gave me a mojito with dark rum, no lime and basically it tasted like just dark rum. Then I asked for that margarita with patron that I originally was going to order. Ok I was being nice but indecisive with my drinks, I apologized a lot for that.

Bartender walks over with an attitude. He was a much older gentleman. He questioned me on what was wrong with my drink, what did I order, how do I like my drinks. Then he reaches over me trying to take my mojito away when I told him it’s fine I’ll share it with someone who may like it but it’s just not for me. He tried to educate me or talk down to me however you look at it, on a mojito which sure I’m no bartender but out the years I’ve been drinking mojitos I have never tasted one like that. This was a work dinner so my coworker took a sip and said that disgusting and NOT a mojito. No one ended up taking the mojito. My whole table seen he had an attitude with me. As I mentioned I realized I was being indecisive and I apologized over and over while I was ordering.

The whole table ordered appetizers for the whole table to share, one of each. Only appetizer I liked were the truffle fries. I ordered the Grilled Salmon and so did half my table. It smelled like fish when it all arrived. Everyone knows fresh fish does not smell. My meal looked very pretty. However it tasted really funny and was not good. Everyone else who ordered the salmon agreed. I didn’t ask about other folks orders. We ordered desserts too which came out timely and smelled good but I didn’t even want to taste it after my dinner.

When I went to the restroom none of the stalls but one had toliet paper. Restroom was not clean. They used drink napkins as paper towels I’m assuming they forgot to order paper towels.

Overall, not the best experience and probably won’t ever come back.

Good/Bad Experience. I thought the food was nasty and so did my boyfriend. I got the mushroom bruschetta was pretty much the whole reason we went here. We are visiting from out of town and I saw it on an ad and it looked so good. I got it and the bread was drowning in cheese - don’t get me wrong I love cheese but it overpowered everything else which honestly might have been a good thing because the mushrooms tasted like they were out of a can.

Then I ordered the meatballs and my boyfriend ordered the rustico burger. The meatballs tasted just like frozen meatballs that had been reheated in like a canned Ragu sauce.

The burger he ordered well done and it was medium when he got it very very pink. The manager offered to have it recooked which was nice but then it took forever for it to come so my meal was stone cold by the time he got the remade burger . And the remade burger was drowning and I mean drowning in mayo . Also the fries on the remade burger plate were stone cold as well.

The service was good the wait staff was attentive but food was not at all worth what we paid for it. I was so disappointed and won’t be back.

Don’t let them ruin your evening (or lunch). I went in with some colleagues and ordered a plate of pasta. Our server was 100% unprofessional. She wasn’t able to answer any single question we asked and very slow. It was 2-3 times food and drink were brought to our table while it belonged to another table. Food was a little below standard (2-3 stars for just food). Very salty though. When we were about to head out and asked for the check, the manager came in and informed us that THEY LOST THE CHECK!! I didn’t expect this. We demanded that we definitely needed the receipt. He finally figured something out after a few back and forth of lossy and unprofessional reasons. I thought a messy evening was done but NO. A few hours later I got a notification that my card was charged another $22.xx OUT OF NO WHERE. We’ve already left the restaurant but two extra orders were charged to my card. The next day I stopped by the restaurant again to make things right (around 12pm). The manager promised me to sort it out at that time and politely kicked me out of the restaurant. Nothing was done until that evening I had to call them again and it turned out that they have not done anything. They said I ordered 3 items when I’ve only order a plate. I told them that and they finally processed the refund BUT THE AMOUNT WAS NOT CORRECT. I called them again about this and they said that they couldn’t do it now because the first refund was not processed yet and now I need to wait for it to be processed and call the restaurant again when it’s done to get the rest of the money. Totally a waste of time and money, plus NO APOLOGIES WHATSOEVER!! They acted like it was my fault wanting to get a refund.. well you don’t want to pay for something you didn’t order, didn’t eat and just came out of no where, right? They even hanged up my call without saying goodbye, the waiting time for the call is extremely long, very rude, very unprofessional staff, I can’t believe how this restaurant is still in business. As of now that I’m writing this review, I have not received the refund yet and still waiting. AVOID AT ALL COST!!

Edit Dec 15: They replied to me saying that I was fully refunded but I was not! They did refund me but the amount was not correct. I called in the restaurant a few times and they promised to refund me the rest but that never happened. Every time it took very long to hold on the line and the staff hang up right after finished the conversation. Very disappointing service.

I’ve gone to Darna a billion times over the years and there is always good drinks, great people, awesome music, and amazing vibes. If you’re hungry for a delicious bite and great  decor and beats, come here!

We had hookah & a bottle of champagne; didn’t dine because we just left brunch. The food looked good from what we saw; will have food next time & update review. We had a vip hookah (cant remember flavor) it was very smooth & long lasting. They periodically the change coals without needing to be prompted 👍🏽The deejay was awesome & played a good variety of genres. Be sure to get your id & credit card back; we got caught up in the moment & the person who paid didn’t realize until the next day that our server never returned those items; even at checkout. Other than that mishap, everything else was good & I would go again.

Was pleasantly surprised.... after reading some the reviews,  I was very skeptical about this place.   The door guy/bouncer was absolutely amazing and adorable.   The service is excellent,  everyone is so friendly!!  Very chill place.  Will be returning for sure

They charged our card THREE separate times and charged us wrong. The third time they were lucky we were across the street at the gas station and let them charge us the right amount. But the OWNER was rude to all of us and our friends go there a lot. They barley discounted our check the third time even though we now have over $400 worth of charges to our card. The waitress ran across to the gas station to ask us for our card. Totally uncalled for since she gave us our check and we signed for it. The first time she also gave us the wrong card and ID. Terrible service considering she sat with a nasty man the whole time and we had to go up to her to ask her for a drink across the room. Would never recommend or come back. Trash.

Don't ask them for tap water. They'll deny you, say that they only have bottle for $7. Nevermind that they're a fully functioning bar serving customers alcohol. Talk about a venue that considers customer safety.

We visited here thinking this was a real authentic Chinese food place, and left with mixed feelings.

Service was actually decent. The food, not so much. We ordered an scallion pancake, and found a lot of pepper inside (see picture). This was absolutely not authentic. We also ordered steamed beef dumpling but received fried dumpling instead. For the hotpot combo, it was OK with a good balance of seafood, protein, and vegetable. For some reason though we were charged an additional broth $3.95.

From the outside, this place looked very authentic Chinese. Yet there was no one speaking Chinese, from reception to waiter. The menu was English only and it was hard to read through translation. Pictures from previous reviewers showed a much nicer menu and apparently that was no longer the case. It seems the restaurant is under new management. It is a rather exotic than authentic place.

We had a great experience at Mala Tang for dinner. My friend and I both got indivual hot pot dinners and I got frozen tofu, cabbage and udon. The spicy broth was incredible and just at the right level for me, though I was sniffling throughout!

Another friend got the dry hotpot and fish soup and loved it. The portion sizes were huge and we all had a ton to take home, just as good heated up. :)
I had a dry hot pot… it was not bad, but hard to say worth it or delicious or authentic. Also, They don’t care people come in to the restaurant. I waited for about 10 minutes to see a waiter.
Better atmosphere than your typical Chinese restaurant. Was very pleased with the dishes ordered, especially the beef/beef tripe in spicy sauce. Generous portions, authentic taste. Will return.

Find another place. The only thing good about this place is the exotic feel and friendly server, but even so, the server can lack professionalism.

First, the broth for the mala bites is just not flavorful. It tasted as if water down.

Second, the beef skewers is not tender at all,  definitely frozen.

Third, the veggie skewers came in two pieces per skewer for 75 cents a skewer.

Fourth, the stir-fried dishes are a bit salty, but definitely better than the mala bites.

We were the only table there, so that should've been a warning sign.

Charged more than what is on the menu.. stated that their menu prices had changed and they hadn't changed it on their menus yet.

Messed up orders ... And did not give correct change.

Maybe they were just having issues with their system or maybe they are under New Management?

Was not the best experience, but will try again another time....

Poor selection, high prices, no place to park, and if you do park in garage it's $6 for hours 0-1.  No validation offered by restaurant.  I'll take my appetite and money elsewhere.  Sad to see as booeymongers used to be a cool place to eat.

Powdered breakfast to go late on a Sunday morning. Food was hot and fresh upon pickup. Portion sizes exceeded expectations and we could tell everything was homemade from the home fries to the egg white omelette in the yoga breakfast. Would definitely eat here again the next time we visit the area!

Ordered A Ceaser Chicken Wrap From This Place. Had A Very Weird Taste Both Lettuce And Chicken So I Go Back Into This Establishment Because I Wanted My Money Back An The Cashier Looked At Me Like I Was Crazy. As Well As Noticing There Was An Expired Fruit Sitting In The Cold Section Of Where The Cakes Are Shows Nobody Really Pays Attention..Will Not Recommend
I am absolutely obsessed with their veggie sandwich! love it!!!

This sports bar is excellent. Always have a good time here. The food is a great price and tasty. There are tons of TVs and lots of food options. Great for groups. I would come back. It's def a sports vibe with tons of attendees. Highly recommend!

Very nice little neighborhood sports bar and dive bar in the heart of Ballston where you can watch sports on one of the many big-screen TV’s if sports are your thing, order chicken wings or many many other different kinds of pub-grub, order craft beer, and more. They could do better with the craft beer selection, but everything else is pretty good. The staff are nice and the decor is nice and creative. In a neighborhood like Ballston where nearly everything is changing, this is one of the last dive bars of its kind and it’s like a neighborhood gem so to speak.

First Down Sports Bar is a decent bar to go to if you’re in the Ballston area. When I first walked in, I will say the smell was not too pleasant.. it smelled a little old and humid. I was there during their happy hour and took advantage of their rail drinks which are only $4.99! I got a bourbon with pineapple and cranberry. The food was honestly way better than I expected. I ordered a chicken wrap with spicy garlic butter... it was on point!

Best wings in Arlington. Steer away from the salads and stick with burgers, wings, onion rings and fries.  And I’ve never reviewed a bartender (s) but when you consistently see anyone doing their job at the top of their game , it just makes the visit better:  Tom and Liza are rockstars - best and happiest bartenders I’ve met or seen

Sunday football 🏈 playoffs! My Cowboys lost… 😖

Fantastic friendly fun service from Talia & Crew. Wings, waffle fries, ample libations. 🍺 🍻 A genuinely awesome time with pals! 🇺🇸

—————

Cool little hangout, actually bigger than appears from Fairfax Drive, with large back room huge enough for a good group gathering. Excellent sports viewing and sliders to nosh. Fantastic table service by Teo & his bro’s make the Sunday football game losses bearable. 😎

—————

Delish wings, finely seasoned and cooked just right. For me, the burger was perfect, a perfect end to a very busy day. Drinks made by Slick-Barkeep Anthony (and on occasion, Manager Paul) real down and done rightly. The tv’s are positioned well, not too loud, and show just about all that day’s live sports & such commentary you can enjoy free.

Not too expensive, a good choice for you to splurge for yourself and on a buddy you care about. However, this is indeed the NoVa area, and you are sitting yourself in Ballston [“Little Manhattan”] so understand if you just arrived from Ottumwa Iowa, Milwaukee Wisconsin, or perhaps Tucson Arizona that prices are commensurate with the government blowing up the economy fast with a nonstop flood of your tax dollars. [And if you are lucky enough to benefit from the gov’t paying out more and more and more, then please leave a generous tip at the bar or on your table. These dudes earn it so!]

See y’all at the zinc!

~Newmie 🙏🙏🏽🙏🏿🤠

Decided to stop by since I was in town in Arlington for work. One of my colleagues had recommended it highly, and I really wanted to check it out. I was not disappointed. Since I was in a hurry, I ordered half a rack (two beef ribs) and their "spicy" fries along with some sweet tea. A very polite salesperson took the order and a pleasant server brought it out in five minutes. The beef ribs were thick tender and juicy and required just a littlebit of their ature sweet BBQ sauce to take it over the top. The fries were anything but spicy, but were hot and fresh with definitely some kind of seasoning on them. The sweet tea was fabulous.  Although at $33 (with base tip, military discount and tax)  the food was pricey, I will definitely come back for more ribs!

Great BBQ, good prices, great service and a wonderful atmosphere. I had the tree meat platter and chose the brisket, pulled pork and smoked sausage. For the sides I had the mint cucumber salad and the Mexican corn salad. Flavor was incredible!! Brisket was smoky and delicious, tender and juicy. The pulled pork was not as wet but not dry either. Full of fla or but I did chose to try out the house BBQ sauce just to try it out. The sausage was grilled to perfection. It was drizzled with onions and peppers and full of amazing flavor. My sides were a perfect complement to all the meat. Fresh cucumber with a hint of mint and seasoning. The corn dish was extremely tasty and fresh. I will definitely be returning and would highly recommend this place to anyone that enjoys great BBQ.

Unique bbq joint on the outskirts of Arlington. The food here isn’t bad, but it’s not the great bbq either. For the area, it’s one of the better ones. The bbq was on the dry side and the sauce was kind of acidic. The coleslaw wasn’t as creamy and was basically course chopped cabbage. The pulled pork egg rolls are pretty good though.

Update:

I decided to give it another try.
The beef ribs were really flavorful and tender. My sides were delicious as well (onion rings and salad). It was a bit expensive, but the meal was definitely enjoyable.

The service was friendly and attentive.
Definitely a better experience.
_______________________________________________

Original review:

After hearing positive reviews about Rocklands, I  purposed to check them out.

I have to give them another chance because I am a little disappointed. I opted to dine in but needed my meal in a to-go setup. I was obliged but did not receive my order until I walked to the counter. The staff were apologetic but did not offer to replace the meal (they were supposed to bring it where I was seated).

The place is clean, with steady customer traffic. The aroma fills the air before even getting close to the parking lot.

My food was cold and I felt a bit underwhelmed by the portions.

The brisket had a nice bite and flavor but was teetering on the dry side. I found myself needing to use sauce to eat. And the sauce was pretty tasty. My sides were cold so I really could not enjoy.

In all, I will try again at a later date and update. I cannot really say for now. They were very apologetic upon my exiting, but my view remains unchanged.

Rockland's lives up to the BBQ legend. The facility is great and has plenty of eye candy besides the amazing food. There are about 25 parking spaces and street parking, tons of seating inside and outside.

First impression of the outside decor was amazing. Yellow Fiat being a mascot was great touch. That being said, their pizza was not as great as their decor. Margarita was OK. Truffle mushroom pizza was disappointing. Mushroom smelled old, and was very vinegary. and quite slimy. I could smell the truffle oil but it was probably touch too overpowering. Cream sauce was too salty IMO, making overall pizza very salty for creamy pizza. Maybe the pizza I chose wasn't their greatest menu but that particular pizza wasn't that good.

Closest to the real authentic italian pizza I’ve tasted in the area so far. Real firepit charred pizza crust topped with fresh ingredients. These are not your typical salty, greasy, and dry pizza. These are baked to its perfection with simple but perfectly seasoned fresh and juicy ingredients. They would definitely taste better when dining in than delivered since pies are so delicately baked to its perfection. Good wine options and loved the italian vibe in the dining area. Will definitely come back to try all of their pizza!!!

Delicious. Reminded me of when I went to Naples and ordered 2 pizzas at the top two places. I’d say if you live in the DC metropolitan area you can save several thousand dollars by skipping your Naples trip and coming here. However, it’s easy to enjoy it so much that you’ll use those same thousands of dollars on pizza here.

They even have a TV live feed from the main dining area so you can see your creation being made.

Excellent pizza. We split two plus an appetizer and had plenty to take home. Great wine pairings as well. Cute outdoor seating area.
The staff seemed knowledgeable about the ingredients of the pizza which shows they definitely know their product.

The place doesn’t look very impressive, but the food was actually pretty good. The pizza was freshly made, and you can see the oven when entering the door. We also enjoy the brussels sprouts. Since it’s made to order, it takes some time to wait for the food (probably ~20 minutes), so it’s better to come here when you are not in a rush.

I’ve been wanting to stop by due to the name and I’m glad I did! The burgers were pretty juicy and tasted good. There are a lot of menu options including a variety of burger toppings, burger bowl and chicken sandwich. It’s fast casual but I think the quality of the burger is higher. Shake was awesome and made the fries even tastier when dipped in. The sauce they included with the fries was a little disappointing, tasted off like they put too much mayo in it. Still a decent place for a burger if you want to splurge. Lots of outdoor seating space!

Wow!! One of the best burgers I've ever had! I have a smaller appetite, so I generally get a kid's meal. Just the right meal size for me with a generous serving of fries. The drink selection is incredible! I tasted the blueberry soda (the bomb), the Mexican coke (smooth) and two of the flavored, non carbonated drinks. And I get to bring home the Frisbee that my meal was served on. Really cool experience!

Phenomenal burgers! This place has a very accurate name with big buns and damn good burgers! The cheese fries were good with a bit of a kick to the cheese sauce. The kids meal was ample and included the fries and drink. Forget standard fountain drinks, this place has speciality and craft drinks, which my son enjoyed (Maine Root Beer and ginger pear juice). The milkshakes were super delicious, made with very good ice cream. My family split a chocolate shake and white chocolate peppermint milkshake. Highly recommend! It was clear that everything was made with fresh and high quality ingredients. My husband and I both got the classic burgers. I couldn't even finish mine, it was so big.

Now that's a tasty burger.

An excellent quality of seasoned beef meets freshly grown produced and top-notch craftsmanship to make, as I might have said in pulp fiction, a damn tasty burger.

They also have a selection of brews, and adult powered Frozen beverages.

Really good burgers and fries at this joint. I got the Hot and Hefe burger and it wasn’t strictly spicy, rather a good spice flavoring with the aioli, pepper Jack, and cooked patty all combining to give a unique experience. They do a seriously great job with their sauces here. The truffle Parmesan fries were also solid, elevated by their dipping sauce as well.

Great Tex-Mex spot in the heart of Arlington. Service was top-notch, it got crowded on a Saturday night so plan accordingly! Even with the crowds the staff were expedient and maintained a very friendly attitude. Most importantly, the food and drinks were great! Recommend getting a pitcher to share and don't skip the desert if you have a sweet tooth. The Xango (like a fried banana cheesecake) was delicious. Excellent date night spot!

The atmosphere is mediocre. It’s dark and a bit haphazard. The parking is not great (old lot with small, umarked places). The food is lackluster with feelings of microwave-inspired instant dinner. The queso HAD to be COSTCO brand. It was too expensive for the quality. The service was great and it’s too bad they don’t have a quality product to present. We won’t be returning.
Tied out this place for dinner, it was okay. No beer on draft but they had at least 3 taps I saw. The food was okay, but not great. The service was good.

I had the Carne Asada. The steak itself was great, not over seasoned and cooked to temp. Other than that, the rest was cheap and not very good. The waitress seriously lacked presence and barely said anything to us. Would have spent more if she ever asked us or offered us another drink. Saw a few people looking through my car’s windows in the parking lot just be careful if you’re driving here.
Classic Tex-Mex joint in an unassuming location! Incredibly delicious food - with solid tacos, burritos, enchiladas and chimichangas. Would absolutely recommend for dine-in or carry out.

Good fried chicken. The delivery service was great and free. I got an online deal...
I’m not a huge fan of spicy/greasy/fried food and I had a bad experience with Popeyes before but I gave them a second chance and it was great, good fried chicken, cheap and it was not that greasy tho.
Cajun rice and Cajun fries are yummy.
I recommend this location.

Food poisoning!  Do NOT eat here!  I moved here about a month ago and had a taste for Popeyes.  I bought an 8 piece spicy family meal (with 2 sides).  The pieces were not spicy as I ordered.  And, it could not have been chicken because the pieces were just too small....maybe it was a pigeon.  In addition, they were burned.  Yes, burned.  Parts of the crust were black.  And, for this it was over $40!!!!  I ate this on March 4 and spent the entire night in the bathroom with diarrhea.  Even this morning on March 5, I am still not well.  This place is horrible and needs to be shut down.

I ordered badly, so take this with a grain of salt.  I was excited about the idea of a blackened chx sandwich.  I should have known better when they offered non-spicy (mayo) and spicy (spicy mayo).  The blackened chx should have the spice - that's what should make it spicy!  The spicy mayo had some heat but tasted funky.  Might work for some but not what I'd hoped for.

This is the universe telling me I shouldn’t be eating fast food. Never go here. Without a doubt they will steal and rob from you. Why I don’t ever check the bag I don’t know.  they always make substitutions without telling you. They always forget part of the order. the staff is unfriendly. Please save your money and go somewhere else or better yet, Just cook at home. Hands down the worst Popeyes in the DMV.

Fast service, I only waited 5 minutes to get my order ready. Friendly staff and delicious fried chicken!!!
On top of all that, they offer Halal Chicken! You have to ask for it though. Just make sure you are ordering Halal chicken if that's what you want.

{Not the gravy in the mashed potato though, it has pork}

I am definitely coming back when I am craving fried chicken :)

Delicious as always, never disappoints. This is the Kale Caesar, well after I had to give it a taste😊😉.with blackened chicken. I substitute the Caesar dressing for the Spicy Cashew dressing. I suggest giving it a try.

I’m giving it one star because I used to love going here. But recently the salads are just not good. They don’t put as many toppings as they used to, you’ll get four small pieces of chicken, etc. I’m not sure what’s going on but I have a feeling management has told them to cut back on ingredients because it’s been consistently disappointing!

Over priced salads with customers that are trying to eat healthy while they trash  a shared sidewalk. There is always trash left behind, and all the so called healthy and environmentally friendly customers are full of BS. They can't even walk around the block or enter the store to dispose of their trash, they prefer to overfill the public trashcan or just leave it on the sidewalk, see photos. This is an everyday event.

I enjoyed working for Sweetgreen as a company but the Head Coach, Tashia Harris is terrible.
I am happy they came a long way from their days at the Harriet Tubman Women's shelter. However their lack of professionalism was enough for me to leave without giving notice.
I just got a call from this location and clearly they must have the wrong number.
I would gladly return to Sweetgreen when this individual is fired.
I will not hold my breathe.
Everyone else was a joy to work with.

Extremely overpriced... they charge for cheese and breadcrumbs?! Any decent topping costs at least 1.25 extra. I paid 2 bucks for a tiny scoop of portabella. The only free thing was a cold stale piece of bread

I ordered one slice of the meat lovers pizza and I did not really like it. Parts of my pizza slice had this strange metallic taste to it, almost as if the taste of the cooking tray went into the pizza. On top of that, it was very greasy. Also, I would suggest adding some all natural or even organic soda options to the menu. Lastly, I would also suggest adding a recycling bin, because many recyclable items end up as waste (like the pizza box that came with my order). I cannot really say anything about the other food items, because I only had the meat lovers pizza. However, I do give credit to the people who were working here, they were very nice. I also love the classic look and feel that this place has to it.

First visit here and it was amazing! Me and boyfriend always pass this hidden gem when going to Petco and we decided to stop here for lunch. We got their famous steak and cheese which is to die for. We also got hotdogs, fried chicken, they’re amazing soda glass bottles, and the cheesecake & red velvet cake. They’re reasonable priced in my opinion for the fresh authentic food they provide. Love the vibes here. Will be coming back.

First time in over 50 years I’ve been disappointed!!! The pizza isn’t hot and fresh at lunch, seemed to get a reheated leftover slices, Mario’s has taken a different look from its original mom & pop neighborhood favorite that was the main stay of Lefty and Joe; their love and passion is gone with it being replaced by a food truck without wheels hot dog joint…Mario’s is now dead and buried…only two stars from my leftover memories which was a 5+ star pizza palace.

If you like Sicilian Pizza, this is a great place to grab a “slice”. Rather than the traditional triangle slices that’s more common, Mario’s slices comes in squares. The sauce and cheese is packed with flavor, and if you’re a still hungry their menu has a great selection of other options from hotdogs to hamburgers. Best of all, there’s an ice cream shop attached to the building. Dessert!!

First time here and I will definitely make this a recurring visit. Guy Fieri of Triple D needs to come visit this place. That show can not be legit with him giving this place a food review. The steak and cheese was amazing!!! When they say deep fried chicken, they mean deep fried chicken. The chicken was crisp to a perfection. Their hotdogs were great as well and I am not a hotdog person. If you appreciate old school pop like I do, then you will like their selection of drinks. This is the spot to be late night, date night, or any time of outing. Just make sure your hungry. I will try their ice cream the next time I visit.

name: Jimmy John's
vicinity: 550 North Quincy Street Unit B, Arlington

reviews.text: The service is fast and efficient, the staff works hard and deserve more cash tips.  My sandwich is made perfectly every day, and there are always enough employees on every shift I have seen.  I love the wheat bread and the pebble ice for the fountain soda.

Honestly they should change their slogan to disappointingly slow, mediocre food. An hour plus to get your food delivered even if you order outside the lunch rush. There are better, cheaper, and faster options. Why waste your money here.
Pre pandemic this place was sooo good. Lately, not so much. Please do better & go back to serving killer sandwiches; I really do love Jimmy Johns & would hate to skimp!
2/2 on recent deliveries taking over an hour outside of typical rush times. Last order took over 2 hours before I finally called the store for a refund. Pretty underwhelmed with service here.

Literally the most basic sandwich on the entire planet. Took a while over one hour to even get it to my door. One slice of meat and a few veggies. Go somewhere else! Find another sandwich shop because this is garbage.
